titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)
Chapter 66 – The fairness and the justice
Chapter 66 – The fairness and the justice

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ حَمْزَةَ عَنْ جَدِّهِ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ الثُّمَالِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ ( صلوات الله عليه )  قَالَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَقُولُ فِي آخِرِ خُطْبَتِهِ طُوبَى لِمَنْ طَابَ خُلُقُهُ وَ طَهُرَتْ سَجِيَّتُهُ وَ صَلَحَتْ سَرِيرَتُهُ وَ حَسُنَتْ عَلَانِيَتُهُ وَ أَنْفَقَ الْفَضْلَ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ أَمْسَكَ الْفَضْلَ مِنْ قَوْلِهِ وَ أَنْصَفَ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Al Hassan Bin Hamza, from his grandfather, from Abu Hamza Al Sumaly, 
(It has been narrated) from Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said at the end of his<sup>saww</sup> sermon: ‘Toba’ (a Blessed tree in Paradise) is for the one who makes good his manners, and cleans up his temper, and corrects his secretive deeds, and improves his unconcealed deeds, and spends the excess from his wealth, and withholds the excess from his words, and is fair with the people from himself’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ يَضْمَنُ لِي أَرْبَعَةً بِأَرْبَعَةِ أَبْيَاتٍ فِي الْجَنَّةِ أَنْفِقْ وَ لَا تَخَفْ فَقْراً وَ أَفْشِ السَّلَامَ فِي الْعَالَمِ وَ اتْرُكِ الْمِرَاءَ وَ إِنْ كُنْتَ مُحِقّاً وَ أَنْصِفِ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Muawiya Bin Wahab, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who guarantees four (matters) to me<sup>asws</sup>, (I<sup>asws</sup> will guarantee) four houses (for him) in the Paradise – Spends (in charity) and does not fear the poverty, and discloses the greetings in the world, and leaves the disputing even if he was right, and be fair with the people from himself’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ جَارُودِ أَبِي الْمُنْذِرِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ سَيِّدُ الْأَعْمَالِ ثَلَاثَةٌ إِنْصَافُ النَّاسِ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ حَتَّى لَا تَرْضَى بِشَيْ‏ءٍ إِلَّا رَضِيتَ لَهُمْ مِثْلَهُ وَ مُوَاسَاتُكَ الْأَخَ فِي الْمَالِ وَ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ لَيْسَ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ فَقَطْ وَ لَكِنْ إِذَا وَرَدَ عَلَيْكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَمَرَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بِهِ أَخَذْتَ بِهِ أَوْ إِذَا وَرَدَ عَلَيْكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ نَهَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَنْهُ تَرَكْتَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Bin Fazzal, from Ali Bin Uqba, from Jaroud Abu Al Munzir who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The chief of the deeds are three – Fairness with the people from yourself until you are not pleased with something except you are pleased for with the like of it; and your equalising with the brother in the wealth; and remembering Allah<sup>azwj</sup> upon every state. (This is) not (saying), ‘Glory be to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and there is no god except for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and Allah<sup>azwj</sup> is the Greatest’, only, but, when something comes up to you which Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has Commanded with, you take to it, or when something comes upon you which Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has Forbidden from, you leave it’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الثَّقَفِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْمُعَلَّى عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَبِي مُحَمَّدٍ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ رُومِيِّ بْنِ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) فِي كَلَامٍ لَهُ أَلَا إِنَّهُ مَنْ يُنْصِفِ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ لَمْ يَزِدْهُ اللَّهُ إِلَّا عِزّاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ibrahim Bin Muhammad Al Saqafy, from Ali Bin Al Moalla, from Yahya Bin Ahmad, from Abu Muhammad Al Maysami, from Rowmiyyi Bin Zurara, from his father, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said in a speech of his<sup>asws</sup>: ‘Indeed! The one is fair with the people from himself, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would not Increase him in anything except for honour’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ ثَلَاثَةٌ هُمْ أَقْرَبُ الْخَلْقِ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ حَتَّى يَفْرُغَ مِنَ الْحِسَابِ رَجُلٌ لَمْ تَدْعُهُ قُدْرَةٌ فِي حَالِ غَضَبِهِ إِلَى أَنْ يَحِيفَ عَلَى مَنْ تَحْتَ يَدِهِ وَ رَجُلٌ مَشَى بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ فَلَمْ يَمِلْ مَعَ أَحَدِهِمَا عَلَى الْآخَرِ بِشَعِيرَةٍ وَ رَجُلٌ قَالَ بِالْحَقِّ فِيمَا لَهُ وَ عَلَيْهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Rom him, from Usman Bin Isa, from Abdullah Bin Muskan, from Muhammad Bin Muslim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Three (types), they would be the closest of the people to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic on the Day of Judgement until He<sup>azwj</sup> is Free from the Reckoning – a man whose power does not invite him, during the state of his anger, to wrong the one who in under his hand; and a man who walks (mediates) between two, but he does not incline with one of them against the other with (even) a barley seed; and a man who speaks with the truth in what is for him, and (what is) against him’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ الْبَزَّازِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ فِي حَدِيثٍ لَهُ أَ لَا أُخْبِرُكُمْ بِأَشَدِّ مَا فَرَضَ اللَّهُ عَلَى خَلْقِهِ فَذَكَرَ ثَلَاثَةَ أَشْيَاءَ أَوَّلُهَا إِنْصَافُ النَّاسِ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from his father, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Zurara, from Al Hassan Al Bazzaz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> in a Hadeeth of his<sup>asws</sup>: ‘Shall I<sup>asws</sup> inform you with the most difficult of what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Imposed upon His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures?’, and he<sup>asws</sup> mentioned three things, the first of these being: ‘Fairness with the people from yourself’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) سَيِّدُ الْأَعْمَالِ إِنْصَافُ النَّاسِ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَ مُوَاسَاةُ الْأَخِ فِي اللَّهِ وَ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The chief of the deeds is fairness with the people from yourself, and equalising with the brother for the Sake of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and mentioning Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic upon every state’.

verses.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ الْبَزَّازِ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَ لَا أُخْبِرُكَ بِأَشَدِّ مَا فَرَضَ اللَّهُ عَلَى خَلْقِهِ ثَلَاثٌ قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ إِنْصَافُ النَّاسِ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ وَ مُوَاسَاتُكَ أَخَاكَ وَ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ فِي كُلِّ مَوْطِنٍ أَمَا إِنِّي لَا أَقُولُ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ وَ إِنْ كَانَ هَذَا مِنْ ذَاكَ وَ لَكِنْ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ جَلَّ وَ عَزَّ فِي كُلِّ مَوْطِنٍ إِذَا هَجَمْتَ عَلَى طَاعَةٍ أَوْ عَلَى مَعْصِيَةٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali, from his father, from Ibn Mahboub, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Zurara, from Al Hassan Al Bazzaz who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Shall I<sup>asws</sup> inform you with the most difficult of what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Imposed upon His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures?’ I said, ‘Yes’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Fairness with the people from yourself, and your equalizing your brother, and mentioning Allah<sup>azwj</sup> in every place. But, I<sup>asws</sup> am not saying, (that you should be saying), ‘Glory be to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and there is no god except for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and Allah<sup>azwj</sup> is the Greatest’, and even though this is from that, but remembering Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Majestic and Mighty in every place, when you are confronted upon obedience of upon disobedience’.

verses.text: ابْنُ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أُسَامَةَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَا ابْتُلِيَ الْمُؤْمِنُ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ أَشَدَّ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ خِصَالٍ ثَلَاثٍ يُحْرَمُهَا قِيلَ وَ مَا هُنَّ قَالَ الْمُوَاسَاةُ فِي ذَاتِ يَدِهِ وَ الْإِنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ وَ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ كَثِيراً أَمَا إِنِّي لَا أَقُولُ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَ لَكِنْ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ عِنْدَ مَا أَحَلَّ لَهُ وَ ذِكْرُ اللَّهِ عِنْدَ مَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Asama who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The Believer is not Tested with anything more difficult upon him than three characteristics depriving him’. It was said, ‘And what are these?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The equalisation regarding what is in his hands, and the fairness from himself, and remembering Allah<sup>azwj</sup> a lot. But, I<sup>asws</sup> am not saying (that one should be saying), ‘Glory be to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and the Praise for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and there is no god except for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’, but remembering Allah<sup>azwj</sup> during what is Permissible for him, and remembering Allah<sup>azwj</sup> during what is Prohibited upon him’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ أَبِي الْبِلَادِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ جَدِّهِ أَبِي الْبِلَادِ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ إِلَى النَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَ هُوَ يُرِيدُ بَعْضَ غَزَوَاتِهِ فَأَخَذَ بِغَرْزِ رَاحِلَتِهِ فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ عَلِّمْنِي عَمَلًا أَدْخُلُ بِهِ الْجَنَّةَ فَقَالَ مَا أَحْبَبْتَ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُ النَّاسُ إِلَيْكَ فَأْتِهِ إِلَيْهِمْ وَ مَا كَرِهْتَ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُ النَّاسُ إِلَيْكَ فَلَا تَأْتِهِ إِلَيْهِمْ خَلِّ سَبِيلَ الرَّاحِلَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad bin Abu Abdullah, from Yahya Bin Ibrahim Bin Abu Al Balaad, from his father, from his grandfather Abu Al Balaad, raising it, 
‘He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘A Bedouin came over to the Prophet<sup>saww</sup> and he<sup>saww</sup> wanted (to go on to) one of his<sup>saww</sup> military expeditions. So he grabbed one of the reins of his<sup>saww</sup> riding animal, and he said, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>! Teach me a deed by which I can enter the Paradise’. So he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Whatever you love the people to come to you with, so go to them with it, and whatever you dislike the people coming to you with, so do not go to them with it’. He freed the way of the riding animal’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْكُوفِيِّ عَنْ عُبَيْسِ بْنِ هِشَامٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْعَدْلُ أَحْلَى مِنَ الْمَاءِ يُصِيبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَا أَوْسَعَ الْعَدْلَ إِذَا عُدِلَ فِيهِ وَ إِنْ قَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Kufy, from Ubeys Bin Hisham, from Abdul Kareem, from Al Halby, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The justice is sweeter than the water poured upon the thirsty one. How extensive is the justice when there is justice in it (in a matter), and even if it is little’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ أَنْصَفَ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ رُضِيَ بِهِ حَكَماً لِغَيْرِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Mahboub, from one of his companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who is fair with the people from himself, would be pleased with judging for others’.

verses.text:
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ يُوسُفَ بْنِ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ مِيثَمٍ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ أَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَى آدَمَ ( عليه السلام ) أَنِّي سَأَجْمَعُ لَكَ الْكَلَامَ فِي أَرْبَعِ كَلِمَاتٍ قَالَ يَا رَبِّ وَ مَا هُنَّ قَالَ وَاحِدَةٌ لِي وَ وَاحِدَةٌ لَكَ وَ وَاحِدَةٌ فِيمَا بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَكَ وَ وَاحِدَةٌ فِيمَا بَيْنَكَ وَ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ 
قَالَ يَا رَبِّ بَيِّنْهُنَّ لِي حَتَّى أَعْلَمَهُنَّ قَالَ أَمَّا الَّتِي لِي فَتَعْبُدُنِي لَا تُشْرِكُ بِي شَيْئاً وَ أَمَّا الَّتِي لَكَ فَأَجْزِيكَ بِعَمَلِكَ أَحْوَجَ مَا تَكُونُ إِلَيْهِ وَ أَمَّا الَّتِي بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَكَ فَعَلَيْكَ الدُّعَاءُ وَ عَلَيَّ الْإِجَابَةُ وَ أَمَّا الَّتِي بَيْنَكَ وَ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ فَتَرْضَى لِلنَّاسِ مَا تَرْضَى لِنَفْسِكَ وَ تَكْرَهُ لَهُمْ مَا تَكْرَهُ لِنَفْسِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad in Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Yunus Bin Imran Bin Maysam, from Yaqoub Bin Shuayb, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Revealed unto Adam<sup>as</sup>: “I<sup>azwj</sup> shall Gather the Speech for you in four Sentences”. He<sup>as</sup> said: ‘O Lord<sup>azwj</sup>! And what are these?’ He<sup>azwj</sup> Said: “One for Me<sup>azwj</sup>, and one for You<sup>as</sup>, and one regarding what is between Me<sup>azwj</sup> and you<sup>as</sup>, and one regarding what is between you<sup>as</sup> and the people”. 
He<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> said: ‘O Lord<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>! Explain these to me<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> until I<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> know these’. He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Said: “As for that which is for Me<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>, so worship Me<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>, nor associating anything with Me<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>; and as for that which is for you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, so I<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> shall Recompense you for your<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> deeds with what would you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> would happen to be the most needy to; and as for that which is between Me<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> and you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, so upon you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> is the supplication and upon Me<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> is the Answering; and as for that which is between you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> and the people, so you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> should be pleased with the people what you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> would be pleased with yourself<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, and dislike for them what you<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> would dislike for yourself<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ غَالِبِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ رَوْحٍ ابْنِ أُخْتِ الْمُعَلَّى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَ اعْدِلُوا فَإِنَّكُمْ تَعِيبُونَ عَلَى قَوْمٍ لَا يَعْدِلُونَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ghalib Bin Usman, from Rawh Ibn Ukht Al Moalla, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘Fear Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> and do justice, for you would be finding faults upon a people who are not doing justice’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ وَهْبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْعَدْلُ أَحْلَى مِنَ الشَّهْدِ وَ أَلْيَنُ مِنَ الزُّبْدِ وَ أَطْيَبُ رِيحاً مِنَ الْمِسْكِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ibn Mahboub, from Muawiya Bin Wahab, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The justice is sweeter than the honey, and softer than the butter, and more aromatic than the musk’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) ثَلَاثُ خِصَالٍ مَنْ كُنَّ فِيهِ أَوْ وَاحِدَةٌ مِنْهُنَّ كَانَ فِي ظِلِّ عَرْشِ اللَّهِ يَوْمَ لَا ظِلَّ إِلَّا ظِلُّهُ رَجُلٌ أَعْطَى النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ مَا هُوَ سَائِلُهُمْ وَ رَجُلٌ لَمْ يُقَدِّمْ رِجْلًا وَ لَمْ يُؤَخِّرْ رِجْلًا حَتَّى يَعْلَمَ أَنَّ ذَلِكَ لِلَّهِ رِضًا وَ رَجُلٌ لَمْ يَعِبْ أَخَاهُ الْمُسْلِمَ بِعَيْبٍ حَتَّى يَنْفِيَ ذَلِكَ الْعَيْبَ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَنْفِي مِنْهَا عَيْباً إِلَّا بَدَا لَهُ عَيْبٌ وَ كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ شُغُلًا بِنَفْسِهِ عَنِ النَّاسِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ismail Bin Mihran, from Usman Bin Jabala, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Three characteristics, the one who has these in him, or even one of these, he would be in the Shade of the Throne of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> on the Day when nothing will have the Shade (protection from the heat) – one does not prevent another man from a forward position or move backward except after knowing that his own moving forward is what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Wants.  A Muslim does not blame his Muslim brethren for a shortcoming until he removes such shortcoming from his own self; as soon one removes one defect from his soul another shortcoming and defect (becomes) known to him.  To occupied with correcting one’s own self is a full time occupation (to correct himself rather than finding faults with others)’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ حَمَّادٍ الْكُوفِيِّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْغِفَارِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ وَاسَى الْفَقِيرَ مِنْ مَالِهِ وَ أَنْصَفَ النَّاسَ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ فَذَلِكَ الْمُؤْمِنُ حَقّاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: From him, from Abdul Rahman Bin Hammad Al Kufy, from Abdullah Bin Ibrahim Al Ghiffary, from Ja’far Bin Ibrahim Al Ja’fary, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘Rasool-Allahsaww said: ‘The one who consoles the poor one from his wealth, and is fair with the people from himself, so he is a true Momin (Believer)’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ نَافِعٍ بَيَّاعِ السَّابِرِيِّ عَنْ يُوسُفَ الْبَزَّازِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَا تَدَارَأَ اثْنَانِ فِي أَمْرٍ قَطُّ فَأَعْطَى أَحَدُهُمَا النَّصَفَ صَاحِبَهُ فَلَمْ يَقْبَلْ مِنْهُ إِلَّا أُدِيلَ مِنْهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Khalid Bin Nafi’e Baya’a Al Sabiry, from Yusuf Al Bazzaz who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘No two would dispute regarding a matter at all, so one of them gives the half to his companion, but he does not accept from it, except he would be more just than him’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ جَنَّةً لَا يَدْخُلُهَا إِلَّا ثَلَاثَةٌ أَحَدُهُمْ مَنْ حَكَمَ فِي نَفْسِهِ بِالْحَقِّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Ayoub, from Muhammad Bin Qays, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has a Garden which none shall enter except for three; one of them being the one who judges regarding himself with the truth’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْعَدْلُ أَحْلَى مِنَ الْمَاءِ يُصِيبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَا أَوْسَعَ الْعَدْلَ إِذَا عُدِلَ فِيهِ وَ إِنْ قَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from hammad, from Al Halby, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The justice is sweeter than the water poured upon the thirsty one. How extensive is the justice when justice is done in it (a matter), and even though it may be little’.
